quizz_info_1: Ever heard a gutter punk calling his dog “keta”? It’s a reference to the drug ketamine. It is used for anesthesia on humans and animals, but it can also induce a trance-like state, hence its use as a recreational drug. Its street names are “hippie smack”, “Kit Kat”, or “Special K” among others. The song “Special K” from the band Placebo explores the link between this drug and love. Being colorless and odorless, ketamine has also been used as a “date rape” drug when mixed with alcohol. A recent study showed that ketamine could be used to treat severe depression
quizz_info_2: For more details on this synthesis, see: Org. Lett. 2017, 19, 1124-1127 and Org. Lett. 2004, 6, 4755-4757. For its use to treat depression, see: J. Am. Geriatr. Soc. 2017, doi:10.1016/j.jagp.2017.06.007

cards.condition: 37% aq. HCHO, NaBH3CN, MeOH, rt, 12 h
